register.description: This register controls the PWMSSn (where n= 1 to 3) local Idle mode clock management and software reset

bitfield.description: Configuration of the local target state management mode. By definition, the target can handle read/write transaction as long as it is out of IDLE state.

bitenum.description: Force-idle mode: The local target IDLE state follows (acknowledges) the system idle requests unconditionally, that is, regardless of the internal requirements of th e IP module. Backup mode, for debug only.
No-idle mode: The local target never enters IDLE state. Backup mode, for debug only.

Smart-idle mode: The local target IDLE state eventually follows (acknowledges) the system idle requests, depending on the internal requirements of the IP module. IP module does not generate (IRQ- or DMA-request-related) wakeup events.

bitfield.description: Software reset : 0x0 : Software reset is completed 0x1: Software reset assertion

register.description: The clock configuration register is used in the PWMSSn (where n = 1 to 3) for clkstop req and clk_en control to the ePWM/ eHRPWM, eCAP and eQEP submodules within the PWMSSn subsystem. Note: PWMSS Modules Local Clock Gating feature is not supported. This register should not be modified. Clock gating functionality is controlled by PRCM.

bitfield.description: This bit controls the clock stop input to the ePWM/eHRPWM module : 0: No effect 1: A request to stop interface clock to the module is asserted
This bit controls the interface clock enable (clk_en) input to the ePWM/eHRPWM module: 0: No effect 1: Enables the interface clock to the module
This bit controls the clock stop input to the eQEP module : 0: No effect 1: A request to stop interface clock to the module is asserted
This bit controls the interface clock enable (clk_en) input to the eQEP module : 0: No effect 1: Enables the interface clock to the module
This bit controls the clock stop input to the eCAP module : 0: No effect 1: A request to stop interface clock to the module is asserted
This bit controls the interface clock enable (clk_en) input to the eCAP module : 0: No effect 1: Enables the interface clock to the module

register.description: The clock status register is used in the PWMSSn (where n = 1 to 3) to indicate clock stop acknowledge (clkstop_ack) and clock enable (clk_en) acknowledge status for the ePWM/ eHRPWM, eCAP and eQEP submodules within the PWMSSn subsystem. Note:PWMSS Modules Local Clock Gating feature is not supported. Clock gating functionality is controlled by PRCM.

bitfield.description: This bit is the clkstop_req_ack status output of the ePWM/eHRPWM module : 0: No interface clock stop acknowledged 1: Interface clock stop request is acknowledged for the module
This bit is the clk_en status output of the ePWM/eHRPWM module : 0: No clock enable request acknowledged 1: Interface clock enable request is acknowledged for the module
This bit is the clkstop_req_ack status output of the eQEP module : 0: No interface clock stop acknowledged 1: Interface clock stop request is acknowledged for the module
This bit is the clk_en status output of the eQEP module : 0: No clock enable request acknowledged 1: Interface clock enable request is acknowledged for the module
TThis bit is the clkstop_req_ack status output of the eCAP module : 0: No interface clock stop acknowledged 1: Interface clock stop request is acknowledged for the module
TThis bit is the clk_en status output of the eCAP module : 0: No clock enable request acknowledged 1: Interface clock enable request is acknowledged for the module
